summary: REQ-1 appears implemented: the HTML document title in frontend/index.html is set to "Dini GC". However, the diff also includes multiple unrelated UI/config changes that were not requested and may violate the constraint to only update the displayed site name/title string.

hallucinated_features.description: Broad UI/style changes (colors, borders, avatar rendering) unrelated to updating the browser tab title.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly limits scope to only updating the displayed site name/title string and lists rebranding/other UI copy changes as non-goals.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (App.tsx: removed border; ChatScreen/MessageItem: avatar color changes; index.css: palette changes)

hallucinated_features.description: JoinScreen behavior changes (avatar preview section removed; enhanced error handling/alerts).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; outside the single-title update requirement.

hallucinated_features.description: React Query/backend interaction changes including automatic message refresh and enhanced error categorization.
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goal specifies no backend changes; these are functional/data-layer behavior changes beyond the title update.

hallucinated_features.description: GIF picker improvements and “proper GIPHY API integration” changes.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; outside the title-only change scope.

hallucinated_features.description: GIPHY API key update in application config.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested and unrelated to updating the document title.

hallucinated_features.description: Emoji picker feature allowing users to upload/browse/select custom emojis (or significant changes to that component).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; outside the title-only change scope.

hallucinated_features.description: Addition of project_state.json tracking feature requests/status.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested as part of updating the website title; adds project metadata not mentioned in BuildRequest.
